page.title: 10Farming in Rossett
page.content:
A typical local farm is Rossett Hall Farm which is on the Chester/Wrexham road equidistant from both towns. The farmer, K.G.Brereton, has lived there for 15 years.
It is a dairy farm with 70 acres of land and a herd of 50 friesian cattle. The milk yield per cow per day is between 3 and 6 gallons. The average annual milk yield is 1000 gallons.
The land is mainly used for grazing but the rest is used for growing winter fodder including corn, silage and hay. The hay is stored in an open barn and the corn in a loft. Silage is stored in a new silage pit.
Recently a modern milking parlour and a cubicle shed have been built.
